English (United States)(en-US): ...! Dot, what happened?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ...! 뭉치, 무슨 일 있었어?

English (United States)(en-US): Don’t mind me, <nickname>. I’m putting\ninto motion what I’ve learned today.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 신경 쓰지 마, <nickname>. 낮에 배운 것을\n성공적으로 실천하는 중이야.

English (United States)(en-US): That thinking that I feel good\ncan make me feel good!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘기분이 좋다’고 생각하면\n‘기분이 좋아’진다는 사실 말이야!

English (United States)(en-US): I had doubted its potential\nbefore, but it came through!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이전까지는 가능성을 의심했지만, 끝내 성공했지!

English (United States)(en-US): Like how the man-made\nmetallic bird can fly in the air.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들이 철로 만든 새가\n하늘을 나는 일이 그런 것처럼.

English (United States)(en-US): You mean an airplane?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 비행기 말이야?

English (United States)(en-US): Well... one could call it that. But isn’t\n‘man-made metallic bird’ much cooler?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음... 그렇게도 부르지. 하지만 ‘인간들이\n철로 만든 새’라는 말이 더 멋있지 않아?

English (United States)(en-US): Air-plane. So stiff.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 비, 행, 기. 너무 딱딱해.

English (United States)(en-US): But Dot, you being tangled up in dust\nreally distracts me from what you’re saying.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데 뭉치, 먼지 엉킨 너를 보고\n있으니까 대화에 집중이 안 돼.

English (United States)(en-US): What exactly happened?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 대체 무슨 일이 있었던 거야?
... 그렇다면.

English (United States)(en-US): Now can I tell you about\nmy triumph, <nickname>?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이제 내 성공담을 들려줘도 될까, <nickname>?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. First, tell me what’s going on.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래, 우선 무슨 일인지 이야기해 줘.

English (United States)(en-US): Alright! See, an enormous amount\nof dust clung to me just a while ago.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 좋아! 실은 아까 내 몸에\n먼지가 엄청나게 엉겨 붙었어!

English (United States)(en-US): And I became a black ball of fuzz!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 온몸이 복슬복슬한 검은\n털 덩어리가 되고 말았지!

English (United States)(en-US): Not only did I look hideous, but I felt\nticklish, prickly, and uncomfortable.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 끔찍해진 겉모습은 물론, 몸 속이 온통\n간지럽고, 까끌까끌하고, 거북했어.

English (United States)(en-US): I thought maybe you’d\nleft the window open.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아마 네가 창문을 제대로\n닫지 않은 것 같다고 생각했어.

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, I’m sorry. I’ll remember\nto close it from now.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 앗, 그렇구나. 미안해. 다음부터는 꼭 닫고 나갈게.

English (United States)(en-US): No need, <nickname>. Like I said,\nthis is a story of triumph.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럴 필요 없어, <nickname>.\n이건 말했듯이 ‘성공담’이니까.

English (United States)(en-US): Anyways, that was when I recalled\nthe human I was just telling you about.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아무튼, 그때 난 방금\n소개한 인간을 떠올렸어.

English (United States)(en-US): The human that smiles like a teddy\nbear in the face of tragedies...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 무자비한 일을 겪어도\n곰 인형처럼 웃고 마는 인간을...

English (United States)(en-US): And I attempted to imitate him. To save\nmyself from the ominous dark mire.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 그를 따라해 봤어. 검은 진창 속에서\n불길해진 내 기분을 구원하기 위해서.

English (United States)(en-US): To picture myself as\nsomething... that sways...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나를 하나의... 움직이는...

English (United States)(en-US): sweet yet dangerous.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달콤하고 위험한... 그 무엇이라고\n스스로 생각해 본 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): A Venus flytrap... or rather, dust-trap?|A piece of gum with dust stuck to it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 파리, 가 아니라 먼지 지옥?|먼지를 사로잡은 풍선껌?

English (United States)(en-US): Admittedly a charming plant,\nbut no. Something much kinder.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그도 아주 멋진 식물이지만,\n틀렸어. 그보다는 다정해.

English (United States)(en-US): Admittedly a sweet scent, but no.\nSomething far more fragile.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그도 매력적인 향을 풍기지만,\n틀렸어. 그보다는 연약해.

English (United States)(en-US): A half-melted stick of cotton candy?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 반쯤 녹은 솜사탕?

English (United States)(en-US): Correct. That’s exactly it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 맞아. 바로 그거야.

English (United States)(en-US): l’ve decided to think of myself, dust\nand all, as a soft piece of cotton candy.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 먼지가 붙은 나를 폭신폭신하고 몽글몽글한\n솜사탕이라고 생각하기로 마음먹었어.

English (United States)(en-US): And that makes me feel so much better.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 생각하니 훨씬 기분이 나아졌어.

English (United States)(en-US): After all, one might think I look\njust like I could melt in their mouth!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이 모습이 녹여 먹고 싶을\n만큼 사랑스러울 수도 있잖아?

English (United States)(en-US): I’d like to use this opportunity\nto learn how to live with dust.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이번 기회에 먼지와 함께\n살아가는 것을 배우는 게 좋겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): (Whatever Dot says, it looks uncomfortable.\nPlus we already have the mold!)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치가 말과는 다르게 불편해 보여. 게다가 이미 곰팡이도 있는데!)

English (United States)(en-US): (This time I have to refuse firmly.)|(I don’t want to upset Dot. Refuse gently.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (이번만큼은 단호하게 거절해야 해.)|(상처받지 않도록... 완곡히 말해 보자.)

English (United States)(en-US): But human lungs are not strong\nenough to get along with dust.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 내가 곤란해. 인간의 기관지는\n먼지투성이와 살아갈 만큼 튼튼하지 않거든.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll help you get rid of the dust.\nAnd do a thorough spring-clean.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 먼지를 떼어 내는 걸 도와줄게.\n그리고 나서 방 청소를 해야겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): But I can’t let my dear\nfriend be live among dust...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 소중한 친구가 먼지투성이인 채로\n살아가겠다고 하는 셈인데...

English (United States)(en-US): It doesn’t sit right with me.\nAnd what about our health?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그걸 지켜보는 입장도 곤혹스럽단 말이야.\n게다가... 너와 내 건강은 어쩌고!

English (United States)(en-US): Don’t, don’t, don’t come near me.\nPlease. Just leave us alone...!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다, 다, 다가오지 말아줘.\n부탁이야. 그냥 내버려 둬...!

English (United States)(en-US): But... you said you\nwere uncomfortable.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만... 너도 불편하다며.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ve already put it behind me!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 존재의 불편함은 이미 잊었어!

English (United States)(en-US): To say farewell to the dust, I have\nto first face myself, dust and all.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 먼지와 이별하려면 먼저 먼지\n투성이가 된 나를 마주해야 해.

English (United States)(en-US): Coming to terms with that would be even more\npainful. Like someone crushing my small heart.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이제는 그걸 마주하는 게 더 아픈 일이야.\n누군가 내 작은 심장을 옥죄듯 괴로울 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Just the thought of it\nputs me in misery...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 떠올리는 것만으로 절망스러워...

English (United States)(en-US): Please, leave me alone and just go.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 더 이상 날 괴롭히지 말고 이만 나가줘.

English (United States)(en-US): (Knock on the closet door.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (옷장 문을 두드린다.)

English (United States)(en-US): (Apologize sincerely.)|(Question warmly.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (진심 어리게 사과한다.)|(다정하게 물어본다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, I’m sorry if I’ve offended you...\nI’ll wait until you’re ready to come out.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치, 내가 기분을 상하게 했다면 미안해...\n네가 나오고 싶어할 때까지 얌전히 기다릴게.

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, are you still upset?\nIs it alright if I come in?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치, 아직 화났어? 나 들어가 보면 안 될까?

English (United States)(en-US): (Apologize sincerely.)|(Appeal humorously.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (진심 어리게 사과한다.)|(장난스럽게 달래 본다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, I’m sorry if I’ve offended you...\nI’ll wait until you’re ready to come out.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치, 내가 기분을 상하게 했다면 미안해...\n네가 나오고 싶어할 때까지 얌전히 기다릴게.

English (United States)(en-US): Ohhhh my leg... If only\nDot would open the door...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 다리 아프다~ 뭉치가 빨리 열어줬으면 좋겠다~

English (United States)(en-US): (... Dot’s not budging. I should\napologize in earnest.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (... 뭉치가 미동조차 없네. 진심으로 사과해야겠어.)

English (United States)(en-US): ... Sorry about that. And I’m sorry\nfor earlier, too. I’d like to talk it out.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 장난쳐서 미안. 아까도 정말\n미안했어. 너랑 대화 나누고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): ... I’m sorry I was stubborn.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ... 나도 멋대로 굴어서 미안.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s not like you were\nthe one causing me pain.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나를 괴롭힌 건 <nickname>, 네가 아니었는데.

English (United States)(en-US): ...! Dot, the dust is gone!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ...! 뭉치, 네 몸에 박혀 있던\n먼지들이 없어졌네?

English (United States)(en-US): You seem smaller too. Don’t tell me...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너 조금 작아진 것 같기도 한데, 설마...

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. I rolled, heaved, scratched, and tore the\ndust away from me. It was a fearsome fight.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래. 난 구르고, 토하고, 긁으며 먼지를\n모두 뽑아 냈어. 거친 승부였지.

English (United States)(en-US): And in the process a part of me was\ntorn off, but that doesn’t matter.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 과정에서 내 몸의 일부가 조금\n딸려 나갔지만, 그건 중요하지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): After I sent you away I thought.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너를 내보내고 나서 혼자 생각해 봤어.

English (United States)(en-US): What if next time, after I accept\nthe dust, a thorn pierces my body?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 만약 먼지를 받아들이고, 다음 번엔\n가시가 들어와 내 몸에 박힌다면?

English (United States)(en-US): I will crumble like\na leaf on a windowsill,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 창살에 내려앉은 나뭇잎처럼 무너지거나,

English (United States)(en-US): or attempt to embrace the hole\nin my body until the very end.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 몸속에 뻥 뚫린 구멍을 끝까지\n껴안아 보려 애썼을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Without knowing you\nwould grieve for me...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그걸 지켜보는 네가 괴로워할 줄도 모르고...

English (United States)(en-US): You’re right. It would\nmake me very sad.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 맞아. 네가 만약 그랬다면\n난 정말 슬펐을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): And at some point my battered\nheart would have nibbled away at us.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 어느새 너덜해진 내\n심장이 우리를 갉아먹었겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): ... Your heart?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ...심장이?

English (United States)(en-US): (Imagine Dot’s heart with teeth.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (이빨이 난 뭉치의 심장을 상상한다)

English (United States)(en-US): You mean your soul, Dot?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘마음’을 말하는 거지, 뭉치?

English (United States)(en-US): Ahem, well, <nickname>!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 큼, 크흠, <nickname>!

English (United States)(en-US): Telling a heart and a soul apart is as difficult as\ntelling telling two stars apart from Earth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 심장과 가슴과 마음의 차이는 지구에서\n보는 별과 별만큼 구분하기 어렵다니까.

English (United States)(en-US): My soul will have given in to the pain, just\nlike my body, used to the prickly dust.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 까끌한 먼지에 익숙해진 몸만큼\n마음도 고통에 젖어들었겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): My numb soul might have lost\nthe will to remove the thorn.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무감각해진 마음은 박힌 가시를\n뺄 의지를 잃었을지도 몰라.

English (United States)(en-US): Like scrapes on your body that\nleave scars if you overlook them,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 몸에 난 생채기를 무시하다\n보면 어느새 상처가 쌓이게 되듯이

English (United States)(en-US): so too, can the soul be hurt.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 마음도 그런 법이라는 거구나.

English (United States)(en-US): (I’m glad Dot gets it.)|(And as for my own scrapes...)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치가 깨달아서 다행이야.)|(어쩌면 나도 내 마음의 생채기를...)

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, I’m glad you’ve learned\nto take care of each little pain.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치 네가 작은 고통도 세심히\n살펴볼 줄 알게 되어 다행이야.

English (United States)(en-US): I... want to try too. So I don’t\noverlook my own wounds as well.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도... 노력해 볼래. 너와 함께하는\n동안은 작은 상처도 소홀히 하지 않도록.

English (United States)(en-US): But removing the dust so deeply embedded\nin you must have hurt, are you alright?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래도 깊숙이 박힌 먼지를\n뽑아내느라 많이 아팠을 텐데, 괜찮아?

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, as a wise book once said,\nbirds don’t avoid the toughest of winds.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 책이 알려 주기를,\n새들은 거센 바람도 피하지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): They know riding the winds\nwill take them higher.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 바람을 타고 날면 더 높이\n날 수 있다는 것을 알거든.

English (United States)(en-US): Nothing like a plane that reads the\nwind ahead of time and stops its flight.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 미리 바람을 알고 운항을\n멈추는 비행기와는 다르지.

English (United States)(en-US): Pain and fear and trials!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 고통과 두려움과 시련!

English (United States)(en-US): Things only those with a trembling\nheart, or soul, can feel.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 심장 또는 마음이 새근거리는\n이들만 느낄 수 있는 것.

English (United States)(en-US): All the moving and tragic things that\ntoday’s human fought not to look back on.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오늘의 인간이 절대 돌아보지 않으려고\n애썼던 그 모든 뭉클하고 비극적인 것들.

English (United States)(en-US): I trust that once I get used to the dark, I’ll\nsee the light even without closing my eyes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 어둠에 익숙해지고 나면 눈을 감지\n않아도 빛을 마주할 수 있을 거라 믿어.

English (United States)(en-US): I’d like to let that human\nknow this too... is it too late?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 인간에게도 알려 주고\n싶은데... 너무 늦었을까?

English (United States)(en-US): Well...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 글쎄...

English (United States)(en-US): I think he might have known already.|I think he’ll know by now.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이미 알고 있었을 거야.|이제는 알게 되었을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe he already knew.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어쩌면 그 인간은 이미 알고 있었을지도 몰라.

English (United States)(en-US): And maybe the thought of that misfortune\nstriking him down scared him still.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 알면서도 눈덩이처럼 커진 불행이\n자신을 덮치는 게 두려웠을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe he knows now.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어쩌면 그 인간도 이제는 알게 되었을지도 몰라.

English (United States)(en-US): And maybe the misfortune that struck\nhim down will build him up again.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 마지막에 닥친 불행이 그를 무너뜨리고\n다시 세울 수도 있는 일이지.

English (United States)(en-US): If only one day he’ll be set free\nfrom all he once feared...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 언젠가 그가 두려워하던\n것들에서 해방되기를...

English (United States)(en-US): That he hurts and grieves\nto his heart’s content.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도 그가 부디 충분히\n아파하고 슬퍼하기를 바라.

English (United States)(en-US): Our hopes are one and the same...
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우린 같은 것을 바라고 있구나...

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, I think it will be alright for you\nto have a nightmare just this one night.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 오늘 밤 하루 정도는\n네가 악몽을 꿔도 괜찮을 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): And if you discover an unfamiliar sorrow within,\nand shed tears with abandon once you wake—
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 속에서 너의 낯선 슬픔을 발견하고,\n깨어났을 때 마음껏 눈물 흘릴 수 있다면.

English (United States)(en-US): Tomorrow, let me know\nwhat you dreamed of.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 부디 내일 무슨 꿈을 꿨는지 말해 줘.
